channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dr. Peter Attia’s $7,500 a year biohacking clinic attracted Silicon Valley. Now he’s betting on the wealthy elite of New York City
item.description: Investors back Dr. Peter Attia's biohacking clinic, which he says provides “the most advanced executive physical in the world.”

item.title: How many jobs will AI eliminate? Nobody really knows, and here’s why
item.description: As AI becomes more prevalent in the workplace, there are still too many unknowns to take forecasts of employment doom too seriously.

item.title: Toyota unveils an all-electric China SUV that’s priced to compete in the world’s most fierce car market
item.description: The bZ3X, developed by GAC Toyota, was reportedly so popular it crashed the company's servers.

item.title: Broadcom’s stock pops as upbeat outlook soothes AI investors
Apple cofounder Steve Wozniak says Tesla ‘is the worst in the world’ at improving its technology for drivers
item.description: The Tesla owner says every update makes the car worse.

item.title: Broadcom shares pop as the U.S. chipmaker brings good news to the AI sector
item.description: Broadcom's share price rose by as much as 14% in extended trading, after the firm reported healthy demand for its custom AI chips.

item.title: Trump signs order establishing strategic bitcoin reserve
Why Trump’s crypto reserve may still be far off, no matter what he says Friday
JPMorgan is increasingly worried a second-half stock market rally won't happen
Here’s when Walgreens will go private after $10 billion private-equity buyout
